required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Efficacy & Safety of Resusix With FP24 in Patients With Acquired Coagulopathy
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Single-Blinded, Randomized, Comparator-Controlled Noninferiority Trial to Compare the Efficacy & Safety of Resusix With FP24 in Patients With Acquired Coagulopathy

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 2a study to assess the safety and efficacy of IV infused spray-dried solvent/detergent -treated plasma (Resusix) when compared with an equal volume of plasma frozen within 24 hours after phlebotomy (FP24) in patients with liver disease who are actively bleeding or who require prophylaxis for surgical bleeding

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to receive Resusix or FP24

primary_outcome.measure: Total incidence of all related SAEs

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by thromboelastography (TEG) or rotational thromboelastometry (ROTEM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of plasma to correct INR
Volume of fluid (e.g., crystalloid, colloid, blood component) administered
Change in bleeding score in patients with active bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as excellent, good or poor

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sequential Organ Failure Assessment Score (SOFA)

arm_group.description: The experimental drug (Resusix) will be administered intravenously to subjects enrolled in this arm of the study. Subjects may receive doses of 1-4 units during the blinded intervention period.
The active comparator FP24 will be administered intravenously to subjects enrolled in this arm of the study. Subjects may receive doses of 1-4 units during the blinded intervention period.

intervention.description: plasma frozen within 24 hours of phlebotomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- SBP 90-150 mm Hg
- acquired coagulopathy due to hepatic disease
- INR >1.4
- Order for 1-4 units of plasma for active bleeding or prophylaxis for bleeding prior to surgery or invasive procedure
- Written informed consent
- MELD score: 25 or less (1st cohort), 35 or less (2nd cohort)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Incarcerated patients
- Life expectancy less than 72 hours
- Severe bleeding at time of enrollment
- HIV, sepsis, intracranial bleeding, congenital disorder, anti-phospholipid antibody syndrome or known lupus anticoagulant antibodies
- Receipt of plasma products, coagulation factor concentrates or anti-platelets within 3 days of enrollment
- Specific factor inhibitor activity or history of hypersensitivity to plasma-derived products
- Receipt of iv heparin within 24 hours of enrollment
- Use of a continuous infusion of an intravenous vasoactive medication
- Thrombocytopenia
- BMI greater than or equal to 40 kg/m2
- Participation in another clinical trial within 30 days of enrollment and received investigational product that may impact safety or efficacy of this study
- West Haven Hepatic Encephalopathy Grade 3 or 4 (cohort 1) and Grade 4 (cohort 2)
